item.title: Custom Domain Names with Nodejitsu
item.description:
Here's how to set up a custom domain name for your Nodejitsu app:

1. Find the ip address for your app

You can do this using an online tool such as:

http://dnslookup.nodejitsu.com

Or, if on the command line:

josh@onix:~/$ host virtualwindow.nodejitsu.com
whatismyip.nodejitsu.com has address 184.106.236.222

2. Set the A-record for your app

Using your DNS provider, modify the A-record for your domain to point to the ip you found in step 1. For example, on Linode:

This will typically take a while to propogate once saved.

Nodejitsu does not support cnames at this time.

3. Modify your package.json

Nodejitsu uses a special field in your package.json, called "domains", to keep track of an app's assigned custom domains. For example, the app hosted at http://virtualwindow.nodejitsu.com has the following package.json:

{
  "name": "virtual-window",
  "subdomain": "virtualwindow",
  "domains": [ "jesusabdullah.net" ],
  "scripts": {
    "start": "server.js"
  },
  "version": "0.0.0-11",
  "dependencies": {
    "connect": "1.7.3"
  }
}

In this example, the "domains" property is a list of domains you want to point to your application.

4. Push your changes to nodejitsu

The most painless way to do this, if your app is already running, is to use jitsu apps update to push only your package.json:

josh@onix:~/dev/virtual-window$ jitsu apps update
info:   Welcome to Nodejitsu
info:   It worked if it ends with Nodejitsu ok
info:   Executing command apps update
info:   Authenticated as jesusabdullah
info:   Updating application virtual-window with:
data:   {
data:       domains: [ 'jesusabdullah.net' ]
data:   }
info:   Nodejitsu ok

5. Test it out!

http://jesusabdullah.net
